channel.title: Seeker (Rework)
channel.description:
This is my first suggestion here so don't kill me plz.
I've realised just how Under-powered Seeker is "Gaze" is fine quite Under-powered, but it's pretty acceptable because Duchess also has it but I'd like to see it buffed or something if it stays. I get cult are meant to be quite a bit weaker but classes like Apostle, Invoker and Ritualist are so much more useful then seeker right now.
Anyway here is my suggestion:
Seeker (Cult Investigative) Passives -None.
Day Ability Blood Line - Find out if someone has royal Blood. (2 uses) -Suggested by htm-
Night Ability Identify - Learn target players faction and class type. (3 uses) -Suggested by NuclearBurrito- Stalk - Discover who a player targets, and who targets them. (2 uses)
I feel like Seeker Should be made pretty useful but have limited abilities, it's a shame how useless it is right now.
What do you think Please tell me why it's a good or bad idea I would love to hear feed back. Also do you feel like "Search" Should have 2 or 3 uses? (Still debatable)
Edit: 1. Removed Expose for Blood Line 2. Removed Search for Identify (Seekers abilities in one.)

item.dc:creator: Htm
item.description:
Soulshade55r:

Not sure what to replace “Expose” with it can be good while prince is alive, it could go without a day ability if this makes seeker “too over powered” or something better but a lot of Investigative’s lack day Abilities.

Hmm… maybe this?

Day Ability 1: (insert name here) ~ Discover if target player has royal blood. 2 or 3 uses. This can be helpful if the cult want a way to get to the throne

Soulshade55r:

The observer ability would make it so any Observer converts would be questioned, faking observer without having terrible Logs is extremely hard to pull off well, this somewhat solves it but you can’t get a easy ride because that ability is good to fake claim because it’s two uses only.

Yup I agree

after thinking about it though having 3 seeker’s with probe might be a little OP so maybe it should be 2 uses for balance

t
